Steve Jobs: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.

Albert Einstein: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
Why should I memorize something I can so easily get from a book?

Confucius: The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
If you are the smartest person in the room, then you are in the wrong room.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

Winston Churchill: There is nothing wrong with change, if it is in the right direction.

Stephen Hawking: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
If aliens visit us, the outcome would be much as when Columbus landed in America, which didn't turn out well for the Native Americans.

Steve Jobs: If today were the last day of your life, would you want to do what you are about to do today?

Albert Einstein: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.
The only source of knowledge is experience.
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
Education is not the learning of facts, but training the mind to think.

Charles Bukowski: The problem with the world is that the intelligent people are full of doubts, while the stupid ones are full of confidence.

Albert Einstein: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.

Ziad K. Abdelnour: Smart people think. Brave people talk. Great people act.

Ernest Hemingway: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.

Stephan R. Covey: Paradigms are powerful because they create the lens through which we see the world.

Pablo Picasso: Everything you can imagine is real.

Steve Jobs: If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?

Bruce Lee: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.

Michael Jordan: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.

John C. Maxwell: Dreams don't work unless you do.

Bill Keane: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present.

Chinese proverb: If you want happiness for an hour — take a nap. If you want happiness for a day — go fishing. If you want happiness for a year — inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a life time — help someone else.

Helen Keller: When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us.

Theodore Roosevelt: Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground.

Mark Twain: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

Nelson Mandela: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

Eleanor Roosevelt: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

John Maxwell: Sometimes you win, sometimes you learn.

Mae West: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.

Dalai Lama: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.

Bob Marley: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.

George Bernard Shaw: Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

Dale Carnegie: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.

Alan Dundes: Light travels faster than sound. This is why some people appear bright until you hear them speak.

Dalai Lama: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.

Will Rogers: When I die, I want to die like my grandfather who died peacefully in his sleep. Not screaming like all the passengers in his car.

Albert Einstein: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.

Phyllis Diller: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.

Steven Wright: If toast always lands butter-side down, and cats always land on their feet, what happens if you strap toast on the back of a cat and drop it?

Charlie Chaplin: A day without laughter is a day wasted.

A. A. Milne: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.

Thomas A. Edison: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

Groucho Marx: If you find it hard to laugh at yourself, I would be happy to do it for you.

Charles M. Schulz: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It is already tomorrow in Australia.

Ron White: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.

Steven Wright: The early bird gets the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.

Lily Tomlin: The road to success is always under construction.

Phyllis Diller: We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up.

Clarence Darrow: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President. I'm beginning to believe it.

Margaret Mead: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.

Steven Wright: To steal ideas from one person is plagiarism; to steal from many is research.

Vince Lombardi: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.

Dr. Seuss: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.

Lana Turner: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.

W. H. Auden: We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know.

Hobart Brown: Money doesn't always bring happiness. People with ten million dollars are no happier than people with nine million dollars.

Natalie Wood: The only time a woman really succeeds in changing a man is when he is a baby.

Abba Eban: History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.

Fats Domino: A lot of fellows nowadays have a B.A., M.D., or Ph.D. Unfortunately, they don't have a J.O.B.

Harry Browne: The government is good at one thing. It knows how to break your legs, and then hand you a crutch and say, "See if it weren't for the government, you wouldn't be able to walk".

Claude Pepper: A stockbroker urged me to buy a stock that would triple its value every year. I told him, 'At my age, I don't even buy green bananas.'

Oprah Winfrey: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.

Lily Tomlin: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.

Chris Rock: You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy, the best golfer is a black guy, the tallest guy in the NBA is Chinese, the Swiss hold the America's Cup, France is accusing the U.S. of arrogance, Germany doesn't want to go to war, and the three most powerful men in America are named "Bush", "Dick", and "Colin." Need I say more?

Marilyn Monroe: It's not true that I had nothing on. I had the radio on.

Eleanor Roosevelt: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
